intro: Wahlenbergia albomarginata subsp. laxa, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, sky-blue to white flowers. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a slightly hairy texture. This species thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal and sandy habitats. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers.
